p: Among them the most representative were herbs (36.20%), followed by trees (26.72%), shrubs (25%), climbers (8.62%) and parasitic plants species (1.72%); further, two ferns were also recorded (1.72%). These data are indicative of the richness of the local flora and testify the botanical knowledge of the informants, in accordance with previous studies conducted in Central Nepal [ 28, 29].
